# Andrea De Angelis
**Assistant Professor in Computational Social and Political Sciences**
**University of Milan**

I study the challenges facing democratic politics in the digital age, from misinformation and algorithmic exposure to changing patterns of political participation and judgment. My work combines surveys, experiments, computational methods, and large-scale digital trace data.

I am also a member of the [Digital Society Initiative](https://democracy.dsi.uzh.ch), co-initiator of the [Lucerne Master in Computational Social Science (LUMACSS)](https://www.unilu.ch/en/study/study-programmes/masters-degrees/faculty-of-humanities-and-social-sciences/lucerne-master-in-computational-social-sciences-lumacss/), and Editor at [Frontiers in Political Science](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/892213/overview) and [Politics and Governance](https://www.cogitatiopress.com/politicsandgovernance/about/editorialTeam).

### [<i class="bi bi-graph-up-arrow text-primary"></i> Research]{.card-title}
